main event: A bright light, described as self-luminous and brighter and bigger than a star, was observed for 25 minutes in the southwestern sky over Centerville, Ohio on December 8, 1968.
interesting points: The observer watched the light stay in the same place in the sky for the entire 25 minute duration.
The observer had previously reported seeing a similar phenomenon in the same location on September 26, 1968.
The observer was with his wife when he saw the object, but it's unclear if she also witnessed it.
The observer indicated the object would blink off and on during the sighting.
No physical evidence or effects on the environment were reported.
sighted object: a bright light in the sky
